section.p: DITA Open Toolkit Release includes preview support for the latest draft of the upcoming DITA 2.0 standard.

section.title: Feature Highlights
section.p: DITA Open Toolkit Release includes the following new features:

ul.li: Support for additional input resources #3412
Feature to dynamically adjust result file URI #3413
Refactor CLI to support subcommands #3437

DITA 2.0 Preview: this release includes processing support for the latest DRAFT versions of the DITA 2.0 DTD and RelaxNG grammar files from OASIS (as of March 2020). This means that DITA documents which reference the draft grammar files can be parsed, and where features overlap with DITA 1.3, those features will work as expected. New or revised DITA 2.0 features are not supported except where called out in these release notes. #3449
Add support for the new include element from DITA 2.0. This new DITA 2.0 element is intended to reference text or XML content from other files. #3453
Add support for the new DITA 2.0 specializations attribute, which replaces the DITA 1.x domains attribute as a way to declare specialized attributes. #3440, #3462

Add support for declaring outputclass as a flagging behavior in a DITAVAL file. This DITA 2.0 feature allows you to flag an element by processing it as if it specified the outputclass value in your DITAVAL. #3463, #3482
DITA 2.0: Add support for row and column spanning in simpletable entries, as well for specifying a title on simple tables. #3464, #3465, #3479

section.title: Enhancements and changes
section.p: DITA Open Toolkit Release includes the following enhancements and changes to existing features:

ul.li: Treatment for UncheckedXPathException exceptions #3395
Fix preprocess2 integration tests #3425
added attribute-sets for linklists #3430
Remove unused and deprecated preprocessing configuration #3434
The org.dita.eclipsehelp plugin, which is still bundled with DITA-OT, is now installed from a separate repository. #3442
Use new way of specifying message emitter #3452
Move from JAXP to S9API #3471
Use singleton XML utils #3473

DITA 2.0: where DITA 1.x defined conflicting class values for linktext, shortdesc, and searchtitle in maps and topics, the new draft of DITA 2.0 uses the topic based class value in all cases. Processing is updated to recognize the updated value when these elements are used in maps. #3483

section.title: Bugs
section.p: DITA Open Toolkit Release provides fixes for the following bugs:

ul.li: The DITA 1.x specification defines cascade behaviors for maps such that othermeta and source do not cascade to child topicref elements. In earlier releases the mappull stage of processing pushed these to nested elements; that behavior is now corrected to match the specification. #1899, #3326
Cannot run publishing using a licensed Saxon 9.9 distribution #3383
Run mapref even if input file is not a map #3429
In some earlier releases, a call to an empty stub template for table summary attributes was dropped. Calls to that template have been restored, making it available for easy overrides. #3484
